com.networks.p2pchat

Class GraphicInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.networks.p2pchat.GraphicInterface

  • public class GraphicInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    The graphic interface class is used for displaying all messages to the user and take any input from the user to sent to others.
    Author:
    Anthony, Jacques

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GraphicInterface(PostOffice postOffice)
      The constructor will initialize the ui and will take in a post office object, this is used for displaying messages from the user.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addWindow(java.lang.String ip, java.lang.String channel)
      Create a new client window for displaying messages.
      void displayMessage(java.lang.String message, Peer fromWho, java.lang.String targetIp, java.lang.String targetChannel)
      Display message takes in the message, who the message is from and the target window to display it in.
      void getMyUsername()
      Get my username will initialize the login window object so that the user can enter their username and target connection ip address.
      void handleMessage(java.lang.String message, java.lang.String ip, java.lang.String channel)
      The handle message function is called when the user enters a message into the client window, this is then passed to post office to be handled.
      void removeClientWindow(java.lang.String ipAndChannel)
      Remove a client window from the list (and display).
      void setUsernameConnectionIp(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String ip)
      Function to set the username and ip acquired from the login window.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • setUsernameConnectionIp

        public void setUsernameConnectionIp(java.lang.String username,
                                    java.lang.String ip)
        Function to set the username and ip acquired from the login window. Warning: This must only be called by the login window, as it disposes the window.
        Parameters:
        username: - The new username for the client.
        ip: - The new ip address to connect to.
